column4: Yeah, the problem is everything was working great from when Jaunty was released (and before) until now, and now sound quit. I can't think what I would have done to break it.
have you checked your mixer levels, make sure they're not turned all the way down or muted...
also, make sure pulseaudio is running.
I have, and I think I'd be hearing nothing rather than static if they were all the way down.
I also restarted a couple of times.
if you turn them down via software, do your speakers still produce static?
I get no static with volume muted/turned down in software
what's the best way to stop pulseaudio?
you can try sudo /etc/init.d/pulseaudio stop, or just use ps to determine which PID is pulseaudio, and kill -9 <PID>
pulseaudio stop gives  * PulseAudio configured for per-user sessions
so kill it from your user (not root)
try unloading the snd_hda module (sudo modprobe -r snd_hda) <- not sure if snd_hda is the name of your module...
Looks like that's not it, what's the best way to determine what the name of my module is?
